column3:
Nice!

FWIW, In my own programs, I usually add a "--free" command line option, which optionally cleans up on exit (slowing down exit), rather than the rapid exit(0).  Similarly, since freeing the block index and other numerous structures is a lot of pointless work at shutdown for 99.9% of users, I would suggest something similar for bitcoind.
I certainly don't notice it, but if you want it optional, sure, that can be arranged.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/3427517d507a938074a50fa8ea6dfe3d13bef357 for binaries and test log.\nThis is an automated test script which runs test cases on each commit every time is updated.\nIt, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly, if you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps and if the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bl
How much extra time does that cleanup take? If it's not a huge increase in shutdown time, why make it optional?\n

Very nice.

We can make this optional later, if needed, I'm going to pull now.
